A bank custodian is responsible for maintaining the safety of clients' assets held at one of the custodian's premises and outside depository.
A bank custodian that provides core domestic custody services typically settles trades and reporting services.
No. The funds invested in a CIF are not guaranteed either by the bank offering the fund or by the FDIC
A CIF is established and maintained in accordance with a written plan.
Yes, if your payment is late.
The bank can only charge you an over-the-limit fee if you have not agreed to participate in its over-the-limit coverage program.
